group_1.textLeft: Thank you for sendin' out that boat@so late last night...!

group_1.textRight: Well, it was a request from@the head family...

group_1.textLeft: I apologize for that, but we're sincerely@grateful for your help.
Our purpose for that boat was to@investigate the village legend.

group_1.textRight: What? I warned you it was dangerous@to go out there...
I'm shocked you made it back@in one piece!

group_1.textLeft: Yes, somehow we managed...
In any case...we discovered the truth@behind the legend.
The ship the Diviner and sailor were@on did indeed sink...
But they both survived.

group_1.textRight: Hmm... That's not what the village@archives say.

group_1.textLeft: But it's true.
The Diviner had infused her voice into the ishizuka@and in this bangle in hopes it would reach the sailor.
And in the sunken ship, we found this jade bracelet@that the Diviner had cast into the sea...
All of these things are proof that both the Diviner@and sailor survived that shipwreck.

group_1.textRight: Hrm...
May I have a closer look at that bangle?

group_1.textLeft: Here you go!

group_1.textRight: What was that voice?!

group_1.textLeft: That's the Diviner's voice!@She put it into the bangle!
It's the voice of someone waiting for her lover,@their romance torn apart by tradition...
It's filled with loneliness.

group_1.textRight: ...I see.
It's also a valuable historical artifact@for our village.
We'll look into it more later.
Can you tell us where the shipwreck@is located?

group_1.textLeft: Of course.
If I may, sir...
...but the legend saying the Diviner died out of@divine retribution is clearly false.
Wasn't that the catalyst for the strict custom...
...forbidding love between village adolescents@and outsiders?
Besides, the idea of divine retribution is just@a trick to keep children well-behaved.

group_1.textRight: It was not divine retribution@that we feared.
We maintained this tradition@by decree of the head family.

group_1.textLeft: We never asked for such a thing.
I contacted Mother and asked her@to look into it.
She found that we never made a request like that.@The head family doesn't even have such a tradition.
It seems you must be mistaken.

group_1.textRight: No, we were explicitly told...
...to prevent all girls who could potentially@become Diviners from leaving the village.
When I first learned of it, I believed the existence@of Diviners was just a myth.

group_1.textLeft: Then who could have made a request@on behalf of the head family?

group_1.textRight: Hmm... There was a letter from@the head family back then...
...Aha, here it is!

group_1.textLeft: Mikoshiba...!
You know her, Shizuka?

group_1.textRight: Yes...unfortunately.
So...that's what this is about...

group_1.textLeft: She was the one who forced such an awful tradition@on this branch family... I can't forgive that!

group_1.textRight: That woman...honestly...

group_1.textLeft: Then I hereby withdraw the head@family's request.
Instead, we have a favor to ask of you.

group_1.textRight: ...Let's hear it.

group_1.textLeft: There aren't any Diviners in the village,@and the head family's request is null.
So...can you please change the village's@custom?

group_1.textRight: ...Alright. I'll discuss it with@everyone in the village.

group_1.textLeft: Thank you very much...!

group_1.textRight: Excellent news, Momoko.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah...!

group_1.textCenter: (I can't change the past, sad as it was.)
(...we can act to save everyone from making@those same mistakes again.)
(Just because it all ended in tragedy...)
(...doesn't mean it was all for nothing.)
